content:
Books that I read and enjoyed.
Tech The Go programming language by Alan A. A. Donovan HTTP The definitive guide by David Gourley and Brian Totty Learn go with tests by Chris James Hands-On Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn, Keras, and TensorFlow by Aurélien Géron Deep Learning with PyTorch by Eli Stevens, Luca Antiga, and Thomas Viehmann Practical Vim by Drew Neil REST-API Design Rulebook by Mark Massé Fiction 1984 by George Orwell By the River Piedra I sat down and wept by Paulo Coelho Animal Farm By George Orwell Halo The Forerunner Saga series by Greg Bear Non-fiction Show Your Work by Austin Kleon Tuesdays with Morrie By Mitch Albom Fooled by Randomness by Nassim Nicholas Taleb The Art of War by Sun Tzu The Psychology of Money by Morgan Housel
summary:
Books that I read and enjoyed.

Tech

  1. The Go programming language by Alan A. A. Donovan
  2. HTTP The definitive guide by David Gourley and Brian Totty
  3. Learn go with tests by Chris James
  4. Hands-On Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn, Keras, and TensorFlow by Aurélien Géron
  5. Deep Learning with PyTorch by Eli Stevens, Luca Antiga, and Thomas Viehmann
  6. Practical Vim by Drew Neil
  7. REST-API Design Rulebook by Mark Massé

Fiction

  1. 1984 by George Orwell
  2. By the River Piedra I sat down and wept by Paulo Coelho
  3. Animal Farm By George Orwell
  4. Halo The Forerunner Saga series by Greg Bear

Non-fiction

  1. Show Your Work by Austin Kleon
  2. Tuesdays with Morrie By Mitch Albom
  3. Fooled by Randomness by Nassim Nicholas Taleb
  4. The Art of War by Sun Tzu
  5. The Psychology of Money by Morgan Housel
title: Books

content:
Some of the great articles I read and enjoyed.
The Invitation by svs Being a Noob by Paul Graham My GitHub Project went viral by Aditya Lenge How to keep yourself unblocked by Arpit Bhayani What we got right, What we got wrong by Rob Pike One Billion Rows Challenge in golang by Shraddha Agrawal You are not dumb, you just lack prerequisites by lelouch The Red Car Theory by Anfernee
summary:
Some of the great articles I read and enjoyed.

  1. The Invitation by svs
  2. Being a Noob by Paul Graham
  3. My GitHub Project went viral by Aditya Lenge
  4. How to keep yourself unblocked by Arpit Bhayani
  5. What we got right, What we got wrong by Rob Pike
  6. One Billion Rows Challenge in golang by Shraddha Agrawal
  7. You are not dumb, you just lack prerequisites by lelouch
  8. The Red Car Theory by Anfernee
title: Articles
